oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Old Neophagen White School (Neophagen, Neophagon, Neophogan)

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Schools; Rural schools; One-room schools; Educational facilities
Education - Tennessee; Education - History - Tennessee; School buildings - Tennessee
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Front view of Old Neophagen, a white school in Benton County. The frame structure is set in the midst of trees, with two men appearing on the right.

During this period, the Tennessee State Board of Education was evaluating many one-room schools for possible consolidation. On the back of this image is recorded the following conclusion: "should be consolidated with Liberty." Old Neophagen was an eighth-grade school. Located on Highway 69A six miles north of Camden, it was first called Bells School. H. W. Presson is listed as the teacher for 1927-1928. This school was one of the oldest in Benton County and was eventually torn down.
